topic: faa picks 2 firms to replace 612 outdated radar systems that air traffic controllers rely on

text: The Federal Aviation Administration has selected two firms to replace outdated radar systems.
The outdated systems have been in use for decades.
The replacement is part of a modernization effort to improve safety and efficiency.
The new systems will provide more accurate data to air traffic controllers.
The new systems will enable air traffic controllers to make better decisions and reduce accidents.
The replacement project is part of the national airspace system modernization.
The FAA is responsible for ensuring the safe operation of the national airspace system.
The replacement project is a significant undertaking for the FAA.
The outdated systems are being replaced with new ones.
The new systems will provide more accurate and reliable data.
The new systems will improve air traffic control efficiency.
The new systems will reduce the risk of accidents.
The FAA is modernizing the national airspace system.
The national airspace system will be improved with the new radar systems.
